channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At Trump Rally, Few Local Police Officers in Critical Area Before Shooting
item.description: Local law enforcement officials, present in abundance, said they were not assigned security duties around a warehouse used by a man who tried to kill former President Donald Trump.

item.title: Dozens Dead or Missing After China Highway Collapse
item.description: It was the second such rain-related disaster in less than three months, as extreme weather challenges the country’s extensive network of newly built expressways.

item.title: Junk bonds are now in high demand as Wall Street bets on another Trump presidency
item.description: “US high yield is the trade. It is more domestic-focused and exposed to US economic activity.”

item.title: Before the Alec Baldwin Trial’s End, 2 Jurors Had Doubts About His Guilt
item.description: When the judge threw out the case, the jurors said, they had doubts that Mr. Baldwin was guilty of involuntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting of the cinematographer on the set of the film “Rust.”

item.title: Israeli Jets Bomb Sites in Yemen Linked to Iran-Backed Houthis
item.description: The strike was retaliation for a drone attack launched from Yemen a day earlier, which evaded Israel’s defenses and hit a building in Tel Aviv, killing one person.

item.title: The worst IT catastrophe ever hit less than 1% of all Microsoft Windows devices
item.description: A faulty software update from cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike affected 8.5 million devices globally that rely on the Microsoft Windows operating system.

item.title: After Fire at Sanctuary, First Baptist Dallas Church Mourns What’s Lost
item.description: As officials work to determine the cause, many lament the damage at First Baptist Dallas, a church that grew along with the downtown around it.

item.title: Israeli Airstrikes Hit Houthi Targets in Yemen
item.description: Israel struck the Yemeni port city of Hodeidah a day after the Houthis claimed responsibility for launching a drone at Tel Aviv that killed one person and wounded several others.

item.title: Phishing attempts rise as scam artists try to exploit the CrowdStrike global tech outage
item.description: “We know that adversaries and bad actors will try to exploit events like this,” CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz said.

item.title: Scams Tied to the CrowdStrike Crash Have Bloomed. Here’s How to Stay Safe
item.description: People posing as airline customer service representatives may be making fraudulent attempts to access your money or private data, experts warn.

item.title: Thomas Neff, Who Turned Soviet Warheads Into Electricity, Dies at 80
item.description: An M.I.T. physicist, he engineered an East-West deal that reduced nuclear threats and produced one of the greatest peace dividends of all time.

item.title: Gunman in Trump assassination attempt flew a drone over the rally site ahead of shooting, official says
item.description: More details about the investigation are expected to be made public in the coming week when FBI Director Chris Wray appears before the House Judiciary Committee.

item.title: Trump Campaign Prepares Attack Plan for Harris in Case Biden Withdraws
item.description: The effort, which includes expansive advertising and polling, assumes that the vice president would be the most likely candidate to replace the president at the top of the Democratic ticket.

item.title: World Court Says Israel’s Occupation Violates International Law
item.description: The International Court of Justice laid out it’s most sweeping stance on Israel’s occupation of the West Bank and East Jerusalem, and its settlements, calling for an end to Israel’s presence there. The advisory opinion, while not binding, carries legal weight.

item.title: ‘Black Swan’ investor warns the ‘greatest bubble in human history’ is about to pop and stocks could lose more than half their value
item.description: The federal government will have less capacity to respond, and the economy could enter a recession by the end of this year, Mark Spitznagel predicted.
